page.title: 07 Parkhead Garage.
page.content: Today, Mrs. Fryer and Mrs. Scouler took us to the garage at Parkhead where we met Mr. Shepard, the Traffic Superintendant.There was a big blackboard to tell the drivers what bus to drive, and where to park. Mr. Shepard showed us a Microbus, which has facilities for people in wheelchairs.They can pick you up at your front door.Then we found out that L.A. on buses means Leyland Atlantean, the make of the buses. In the main part of the depot he showed us their new Apricot Computer to record their bus drivers day on a disk called a modular disk.In the cab their is a Wayfarer Machine which feeds information into the computer. There is one for each day to record the information on tickets and money. If they make a mistake it highlights it on the screen.
